author: arnetheduck
content: can run both 5.0 and 5.1 on the same port?

author: pipermerriam
content: In theory yes, but your `5.0` application will need to be robust enough to handle all the datagrams it will receive for the 5.1 protocol which I believe can be done reliably but I haven't gotten to a point where I'm trying that out yet.

author: pipermerriam
content: the v5.1 wire format was designed to make the datagram packets resistance to DPI so that they can't easily be filtered out by over-zealous network admins.  The implication here is that v5 packets can be inspected and identified at the networking level
